cs310
Class LoadWeightedGraph

java.lang.Object
  cs310.LoadWeightedGraph

public class LoadWeightedGraph
extends java.lang.Object

Creating and using weighted graphs defined in files. It constructs two graphs with this information, one directed and one undirected, and then performs a breadth first search on each, using the BFS iterator of JGraphT. Note that weighted JGraphT graphs need to have an edge type that satisfies edgetype instanceof BasicWeightedEdge, e.g. BasicWeightedEdge (as used here). This is a different approach from unweighted JGraphT edges, that can be of any class (but do need the edge objects to be unique for each edge, so that a Map can be made from edges to more info).

Method Detail

loadGraph

public static boolean loadGraph(java.lang.String filename,
                                WeightedGraph<java.lang.String,BasicWeightedEdge> g)
Load a graph (directed or undirected) from a file. It expects lines of the form "A B w" which it interprets as a request to construct an edge from A to B with weight w. It uses Strings A and B as vertices and uses BasicWeightedEdge type edges (see note above.)

Parameters:
filename -
g - a WeightedGraph, so we can use setEdgeWeight
